citations.narrative:
Adult dogs have not been sampled for fecal parasites in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending
Veterinarian. Failure to sample for intestinal parasites in the dogs can delay diagnosis and treatment. The applicant must
ensure that all dogs receive vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs and sampling and treatment of
parasites and other pests in accordance with a schedule approved by the attending veterinarian.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A" license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 06-April-2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Adult dogs have not been sampled for fecal parasites in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending 
Veterinarian. Failure to sample for intestinal parasites in the dogs can delay diagnosis and treatment. The applicant must 
ensure that all dogs receive vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs and sampling and treatment of 
parasites and other pests in accordance with a schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A" license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 06-April-2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
